file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 49-61-03-04 - ELECTRONIC CONTROLLER UNIT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL ELECTRONIC CONTROLLER UNIT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH APU T-62T-40C11 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the Electronic Sequence Unit (ESU). B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT WITH APU ELECTRONIC SEQUENCE UNIT (ESU) - 49-61-03-000-801-A T-62T-40C11 REMOVAL AIRCRAFT WITH APU ELECTRONIC SEQUENCE UNIT (ESU) - 49-61-03-400-801-A T-62T-40C11 INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 49-61-03 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 49-61-03-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH APU T-62T-40C11 2. ELECTRONIC SEQUENCE UNIT (ESU) - REMOVAL A. General (1) Obey the instructions below to remove the Electronic Sequence Unit (ESU). B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 49-00-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 272 272DR Rear electronic compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially To get access to the rear electronic compart- Ladder 1 available ment F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Rear electronic compartment I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A WARNING: BEFORE YOU DO THE TASK OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 49-00-00/200 TO PREVENT INJURY TO THE PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO THE MATERIAL. (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the “APU Control” circuit breaker and attach DO- NOT-CLOSE tag to it. (2) Put the ladder in the position, and open the rear electronic compartment access door 272DR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 49-61-03 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Disconnect the ESU electrical connectors (4). (2) Remove the bolts (2) and washers (3). (3) Remove the ESU (1) from the tray. (a) Install caps and plugs to the disconnected points. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 49-61-03 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 49-61-03-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH APU T-62T-40C11 3. ELECTRONIC SEQUENCE UNIT (ESU) - INSTALLATION A. General (1) Obey the instructions below to install the Electronic Sequence Unit (ESU). B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM TASK 49-10-00-910-802-A/200 APU - START C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 272 272DR Rear electronic compartment D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque Wrench To torque the bolts available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially To get access to the rear electronic compart- Ladder 1 available ment F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Rear electronic compartment I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Remove the protective plugs and caps from connectors. (2) Put the ESU (1) on its tray. (3) Install the bolts (2) and washers (3). Tighten the bolts (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 49-61-03 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (4) Connect the electrical connectors (4) to the ESU. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close rear electronic compartment access door 272DR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100), and remove the ladder. (2) Remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag and close the “APU Control” circuit breaker. (3) Operate the APU ( AMM TASK 49-10-00-910-802-A/200) if applicable. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 49-61-03 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
